research_projects.title: 로봇 친화형 건축물 설계·시공 및 운영·관리 핵심기술 개발 (Development of Core Technologies for Robot-Friendly Building Design, Construction, Operation & Management)
research_projects.lead_organisation: Kyung Hee University I-A Cooperation Foundation
research_projects.description: Development of core technologies for robot-friendly building design, construction, operation and management.
research_projects.detailed_description: The project marks the first phase of the national Smart+ Building R&D plan, targeting service-robot operation inside healthcare and terminal environments. BIM pipelines feed Unity and ROS simulations, enabling early collision-avoidance and path-planning tests before on-site deployment. Currently showing Phase 1/4 funding from Excel records.
objectives: Publish robot-friendly spatial & component design standards
Build a multi-robot orchestration and indoor positioning platform
Run full-scale pilot tests at Gangdong Kyung Hee University Hospital and other facilities
key_outputs: Draft design-guideline document and modular digital-twin sandbox delivered June 2025
Consortium roadmap aligning future phases to UAM- and AV-friendly building research
research_projects.impact: High - First phase of national Smart+ Building R&D plan

research_projects.title: [중견연구 유형1-일반] 제조화건축을 위한 BIM기반 고객 친화형 AI 자동견적체계 및 시스템 개발 (NRF Mid-Career Research Type-1: BIM-Based Customer-Friendly AI Automated Cost Estimation System for Industrialized Construction)
research_projects.role: Data pipeline lead: Revit → QTO → AI estimation API (Python + Pandas + LLM)
research_projects.lead_organisation: Kyung Hee University Department of Architecture - Professor Inhan Kim
research_projects.description: Development of BIM-based customer-friendly AI automated cost estimation system for industrialized construction.
research_projects.detailed_description: This project focuses on developing an AI-powered cost estimation system that integrates with BIM workflows to provide accurate and customer-friendly cost estimates for modular and industrialized construction projects. The system aims to achieve ±3% estimation accuracy and reduce construction cost errors by up to 20%.
objectives: AI-based unit price and labor cost learning
expected_outcomes: H1 2026 paper submission to Korea Concrete Institute
Up to 20% reduction in construction cost errors
research_projects.impact: High - Expected 20% reduction in construction cost estimation errors

research_projects.title: 인공지능 기반의 건축설계 자동화 기술개발 (AI-Based Automated Architectural Design Technology Development)
research_projects.role: Researcher (NLP model tuning & BIM database engineering)
research_projects.funding_source: National Land Infrastructure & Transport Technology Programme
research_projects.description: Development of AI-based building design automation technology using natural language processing and generative models.
research_projects.detailed_description: The consortium is integrating AI with BIM to shorten the concept-design cycle. Maintaining the MongoDB-backed design corpus and fine-tuning transformer models that map client intents to spatial constraints, pushing text-to-BIM workflows toward commercial readiness. Project completed across 5 phases (2021-2025) with total funding of ≈ ₩2.04 billion.
objectives: Convert free-text client briefs to BIM-ready design options using BERT-based NLP and generative models
Automate design-performance evaluation and option ranking
Deliver a cloud-hosted prototype and Revit plug-in by 2025
key_outputs: Public web prototype released Nov 2024; user-satisfaction score ≈ 85%
500-model modular-housing design library populated for machine-learning training
research_projects.impact: High - Commercial readiness for text-to-BIM workflows

research_projects.title: 개방형 BIM기반의 건축설계 적법성 평가 자동화 기술 및 응용기술 개발 (Open BIM-Based Automated Code Compliance Checking Technology & Applications)
research_projects.lead_organisation: buildingSMART Korea & Kyung Hee University (PI Inhan Kim)
research_projects.description: Development of open BIM-based building design compliance assessment automation technology and applications.
research_projects.detailed_description: This completed project established Korea's first open-BIM rule-checking workflow. Contributions centered on mapping IFC entities to rule parameters and building regression test suites that now serve as benchmarks for the newer Smart+ Building regulatory modules. Excel records show Phase 5/5 funding only.
objectives: Translate Korean Building Code clauses into executable IFC logic rules
Develop KBim Assess-Lite model checker and KBim D-Generator for automatic 2D permit drawings
key_outputs: KBim Assess-Lite v2.0 and D-Generator prototype released, adopted by multiple local authorities
30+ peer-reviewed publications and ISARC best-paper award
research_projects.impact: High - Korea's first open-BIM rule-checking workflow established
